SENT.plain: The myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) are neoplastic disorders of the hemopoietic system; multilineage involvement is also evidenced by specific cellular dysfunctions
The von Willebrand factor (vWF), synthesized and processed in the megakaryocytes (MK), is stored in the alpha granules of the platelets
The platelet vWF multimeric pattern was studied in 18 patients with MDS, and in 4 with pernicious anemia (PA), to investigate whether the processing of vWF is abnormal in the megakaryocytic dysplasia
An abnormal multimeric pattern was observed in 10/18 MDS and 4/4 PA patients
The abnormality of this specific protein is the discrete expression of the basic disorder, and is reversible when hemopoiesis is normalized
Although the data do not allow any conclusion, abnormal synthesis is the likely explantation of the abnormality
